intro: Leptocoryphium drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's leucaena, is a species of flowering plant in the Fabaceae family. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and trifoliate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, elongated pods containing seeds. This plant is adapted to drought conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
